scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to prioritize your time off and asked your colleague to reach out to another person. Later, you meet with [Monica] and [Bob] at a team gathering. [Monica] glances at you with a concerned expression, 'Hey [Alex], I heard you didn't help with the urgent task while you were on leave. [Bob] had to stay late to cover for you. What happened?' You responded by saying it was fair to ask someone else to handle it since you were on leave. The conversation continues. [Bob] sighs and says, 'I understand you're on leave, but couldn't you have at least checked in to see if it was really urgent? It put a lot of pressure on us.' You suggested brainstorming ways to handle such situations better in the future. The conversation shifts slightly as [Monica] looks thoughtful. [Monica] raises an eyebrow, 'So, how do you propose we handle these urgent tasks in the future without burdening anyone unfairly?' You suggested setting up a rotating on-call system for emergencies. The conversation continues.
scenes.description: [Bob] rubs his temples and says, 'A rotating on-call system sounds good, but what if the person on call is also overwhelmed? We need a backup plan.'

options.text: We could have two people on call at the same time to cover for each other if needed.
options.analysis: You suggest a practical and empathetic solution, showing good emotional perception and social skills while maintaining balance.

options.text: Maybe we can set up a protocol where the person on call can delegate tasks to available team members.
options.analysis: You offer a reasonable approach, showing good self-regulation and empathy but slightly lesser emotional perception.

options.text: Honestly, if someone can't handle being on call, they shouldn't be on the list.
options.analysis: You emphasize personal responsibility, showing strong self-regulation but less empathy and social skills.
